content.text:
# Recent Updates to elizaOS

The elizaOS repository (formerly ai16z) has seen numerous updates across bug fixes, new features, documentation improvements, and maintenance tasks.

## Major Features

- Added NFT plugin support (PR #2167)
- Implemented file upload security measures (PR #1806)
- Added CoinGecko price per address functionality (PR #2262)
- Added support for Gravity Chain in the EVM plugin (PR #2228)
- Added AGW support to the Abstract plugin (PR #2207)
- Added external router path and new tweet generation capabilities (PR #2081)
- Merged Eliza Installer with the current start.sh script (PR #2229)
- Added plugin for TEE verifiable log (PR #1369)
- Added WhatsApp plugin tests (PR #2213)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed installation process to not force root (PR #2221)
- Fixed Twitter plugin prompt to ensure JSON returns (PR #2196)
- Fixed PostgreSQL adapter migration extension creation (PR #2188)
- Fixed missing LETZAI model (PR #2187)
- Fixed DeepSeek API missing key setting (PR #2186)
- Cleaned up Twitter mention deduplication (PR #2185)
- Fixed release 0.1.8 issues (PR #2184)
- Fixed DeepSeek support in getTokenForProvider (PR #2179)
- Fixed missing langdetect in plugin-tts package.json (PR #2175)
- Replaced invalid Together AI medium model (PR #2173)
- Fixed RAG knowledge for PostgreSQL (PR #2153)
- Fixed chat infinite loop issue (PR #1755)

## Documentation

- Added Greek translation for README (PR #2199)
- Added Persian/Farsi README file (PR #2182, #2260)
- Added "What Did You Get Done This Week? #9" notes (PR #2243)
- Added file nesting for md and DockerFile in VSCode (PR #2177)

## Other Changes

- Renamed ai16z to elizaOS (PR #2211)
- Released version 0.1.8.build.1 (PR #2194, #2193)
- Released version 0.1.8 (PR #2171)
- Performed linting and fixes on develop branch (PR #2180)

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text: Several users have reported installation and dependency issues with the elizaOS/eliza project. These include pnpm installation errors (issues #2203, #2215), lockfile problems (#2183, #2215), and missing dependencies like '@anush008/tokenizers-linux-arm64-gnu' (#2242). There was also an issue with client-direct v0.1.8 failing to deploy to npm, causing inconsistencies (#2227).
Docker-related problems have been identified, with users experiencing errors when building Docker images (#2192).

Runtime errors have been reported, including Twitter authentication failures with Error 399 on Cloud (#2225), React errors with 'Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'useState')' (#2226), and an issue with getRecentPostInteractions returning all memory (#2253).
A feature request has been made for RAG/Knowledge support for Twitter Spaces characters (#2202).

Current cryptocurrency prices show WBTC trading at approximately $94,351-$94,392, making it the highest-valued token in this report. WETH is trading between $3,265-$3,282, while SOL is valued around $187.96-$188.38. The ai16z token is trading at approximately $1.06-$1.16.

Some price fluctuations are visible in the data, with WETH showing a slight decrease from $3,282.39 to $3,265.05, SOL experiencing a small increase from $187.96 to $188.38, WBTC declining slightly from $94,392.52 to $94,351.02, and ai16z dropping from $1.16 to $1.06.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and improvements have been proposed to the elizaOS/eliza repository through recent pull requests:

1. A new character named Nayari has been added (PR #2217).

2. NFT functionality has been expanded with methods for getting owned NFTs, creating listings, and retrieving floor listings (PR #2189).

3. Twitter follow functionality has been implemented (PR #2224).

4. ARM64 support for FastEmbed has been added, improving performance on ARM-based systems (PR #2259).

5. A plugin for TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) verifiable logging has been proposed (PR #1369).

6. Integration with NEAR Protocol Intents has been added (PR #2244).

7. A fix for the Supabase adapter has been implemented (PR #2258).

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 12-13, 2025, there were 30 new pull requests with 26 merged, 19 new issues created, and 61 active contributors. The following day (January 13-14, 2025) saw 27 new pull requests with 7 merged, 12 new issues, and a slight increase to 66 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong engagement with a growing contributor base.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
